column16: What is your annual household income?
column17: What was your overall impression of this event (quality, lighting, sound, value)?
column18: Please share any other suggestions or ideas that would help us enhance your experience at Gesa Power House Theatre. If you would like someone to respond to your feedback, please include your contact information. Thank you!

column17: Reasonable price for concessions & admission. We were in very back row of balcony. I felt a little claustrophobic. The rows were so narrow that we had to practically step on the other people to get to our seats. The wire-type barrier in the front row of the balcony did not feel safe. I also can’t figure out how we would have all gotten out safely if there was a fire. I would rather pay more and have more room to move about.
column18: My four year old grandson just loved the bubble show. I wish the theater would offer more than one showing (maybe 2:00 and 4:30) so more of his friends could have watched to show too.

column17: My son absolutely loved it as did I and my spouse
column18: So far, we have loved every family event that we have been too

column17: The kids we brought enjoyed it.  For the price I was satisfied.  I thought the presentation, sound and especially the stage design pretty mediocre.  I think Jeff could benefit from stepping up the design elements a bit.  I appreciated reasonably-priced concessions, because of course the kids wanted popcorn!  Overall I appreciate having alternative kid-friendly programs and activities.
Absolutely fantastic. Daughter (30s), 2 grands (6&7) we’re all over it!The programming for mixed age, families is fun and helpful to train “concert “ behavior/manners..
The kids loved the bubbles and being able to participate in the show!
column18: I am always happy when I visit! Thank you so much for all the opportunities Gesa Power House provides.
